content.description: A large manufacturing company has tens of thousands of employees, and <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent of the employees have completed a management training course. Suppose a simple random sample of <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> employees is selected.
content.question: Which of the following is closest to the probability that more than half of the sample will be employees who have completed the management training course?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
